titleStmt.title: Mottects or Graue chamber musique Containing songs of fiue parts of seuerall sorts, some ful, and some verse and chorus. But all fit for voyces and vials, with an organ part; which for want of organs, may be performed on virginals, base-lute, bandora, or Irish harpe. Also, a mourning song of sixe parts for the death of the late Right Honorable Sir Fulke Greuil ... Composed according to the rules of art, by M.P. Batcheler of Musique.
titleStmt.author: Peerson, Martin, 1571?-1651.
Greville, Fulke, Baron Brooke, 1554-1628.

notesStmt.note: Six partbooks, each with separate dated title page and register. At head of title, part 1, "Cantus."; part 2, "Altus."; part 3, "Tenor."; part 4, "Contratenor."; part 5, "Bassus."; part 6, "Organ part.".
Signatures: [A]² B-D⁴; [A]² B-D⁴ E² ; [A]² B-D⁴; [A]² B-D⁴; [A]² B-D⁴; [A]⁴ B-E⁴.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
